name: Agent Anything
tag_list: errands, p2p, marketplace, local, ecommerce, concierge, work, community
overview:
Agent Anything is the eBay of services: people can post things they need done, as well as how much they are willing to pay for them, and students can perform these services to get paid.

AgentAnything.com was created to address the needs of two groups of people:

1) Busy, hardworking New Yorkers who don’t have time to accomplish all their daily tasks or run their own errands, and

2) College students, who want to make a bit of pocket money, but need to fit their work around hectic schedules of class, practice and more.

Agent Anything brings these two groups of people together and enables them to trade their resources: a bit of busy people’s money for a bit of college students’ time.

Anyone who needs something done (the “Client”), can go to the website (www.agentanything.com), describe what they need done (the “Mission”), and post it for college students (“Agents”) to see. Clients can offer a specific Reward for their Mission (e.g. $10), or they can choose to accept offers from Agents. Either way, the Client fully controls the price they ultimately pay. Moreover, Clients are only charged AFTER the Mission is completed to their satisfaction.

Only college students can run Missions. Not only does this allow us to easily identify Agents and hold them accountable for the Missions they accept, but with college employment levels at record lows, students need all the work they can get. After verifying their identity via a university ID, Agents can choose from physical (have to go somewhere) and virtual (can be done from a computer) Missions. Even with just a couple of hours between classes, an Agent who plans out a few Missions effectively can make really good money.
